‘The Girl On The Train’ Is Set For Hindi Remake, Parineeti Chopra To Step Into Emily Blunt’s Shoes
‘The Girl On The Train’ Is Set For Hindi Remake, Parineeti Chopra To Step Into Emily Blunt’s Shoes
A girl named Rachel Watson, who is a London-based alcoholic divorcee takes a train daily to observe a perfect couple and becomes obsessed with them. She imagines herself in their perfect life and builds a fantasy world for herself.
But the couple is keeping a secret, which leads to a shocking final of 2016’s hit thriller movie The Girl on the Train.
Twitter
The Girl On The Train, which was based on Paula Hawkins' 2015 debut novel of the same name, is getting a Hindi remake, and Parineeti Chopra has been roped in play Emily Blunt's role, who won SAG and BAFTA nominations for her portrayal.

The movie is hailed as one of the best psychological thrillers. At the same time it has a heartwarming story of woman who is on self-discovery. Parineeti is quite excited to have bagged the role.
Reliance Entertainment has acquired the rights of the remake. The yet untitled movie will be directed by Ribhu Dasgupta, who has previously helmed TE3N starring megastar Amitabh Bachchan.
